H0.text: The 14th day of the cycle is when ovulation usually occurs.

H1.text: The 17th day is when ovulation usually occurs in a menstrual cycle.

H2.text: The 7th day of the cycle is when ovulation usually occurs.

H3.text: The 1st day of the cycle is when ovulation usually occurs.

A4.text: Around day fourteen, an egg is usually released from the ovary.

A5.text: Ovulation occurs when a mature egg is released from the ovarian follicles into the pelvic cavity and enters the fallopian tube, about 10â€“12 hours after the peak in LH surge.
